question: 辞める
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>quit</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to quit</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: "Hey, you going <vocabulary>to quit</vocabulary>?" "<reading>Yah</reading> (<ja>や</ja>) man, I'm going to quit."
